Moment of silence, church bells ring in Boston and across nation for Newtown

Opinion | Brian McGrory

A final column

Globe readers showered Christmas in the City with nearly $100,000 and thousands of gifts, which partly explains the bittersweet feelings I have in leaving this column today.

Had enough of the end of the world?

It's a plotline long predicted and embellished on TV, and in movies, books and songs. Is the genre at the end of its rope?
Opinion | Dan Shaughnessy

The end of all things... sports

The Mayan calendar says Friday is the last day in the history of the world. Here’s what this means to sports fans.

Will Weld run for Senate?

Maybe the timing, so elusive in recent years, is right for former Massachusetts governor William F. Weld, who had longed to be senator.
Opinion | Scot Lehigh

Warren in front on guns

Elizabeth Warren has long endorsed a national ban on assault weapons. Scott Brown recently came out in favor. If you believe gun control is needed, you can count on Warren.
Opinion | Derrick Z. Jackson

Obama should channel Howard

Former Australian prime minister John Howard passed gun legislation within a month of a massacre of 35 people. Obama must now take Howard’s path of leadership.
Sports Media

Scary surgery for Sean McDonough

The ESPN broadcaster and former television voice of the Red Sox is recovering from surgery to repair a hole in the bone near his left ear.
